oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Clinical Examination of Cattle. Pt. 2: Examination of the Herd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blood, D. C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cattle
clinical examination
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To examine all of the cattle in a herd is often not possible because of the cost involved and the principal decision before beginning the examination of a herd is to establish what the costs and benefits are likely to be and then to decide on a procedural pattern which will not sacrifice accuracy for speed and, on the other hand, will not spend unnecesary time accumulating unnecessary information. This paper is presented in order to provide some ground rules, some guidelines, for the field veterinarian faced with the task of examining a group of animals.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1981; 14-21
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright (c) 1981 American Association of Bovine Practitioners
